captions.text: Thanks for joining us.
Thanks for having me.
Alright let’s do this.
Scene Zebra. Take One! Mark!
We gathered 50 people to ask them a simple question
So we’ve got one question that we want to ask you today.
Ok well...what’s that question?
The question is:
If you could change one thing about your body what would it be?
Um….
Only one? [LAUGH]
Um….I would change my
forehead.
I have a really big forehead.
I’d like to be taller.
The puffiness of my face.
My ears. I have big ears.
Stretch marks after having a baby.

A lot of times like kids would make fun of
me.
Like, “Hey man you’ve got big ears.”
“You’ve got Dumbo there.” You know?
Definitely my skin.
Because I’ve dealt with acne and eczema issues
ever since I was a little kid.
When I was young,
because everybody liked girls with big eyes,
I also hoped my eyes could be bigger.
Growing up like a lot of people called me “fivehead!”
or like, “your forehead is so big.”
They would always say something to me about it.
I would say it's because everybody walks straight,
and my foot's a little bit crooked.
When I was younger
I felt like I wasn’t quite adequate enough.
Can you sit on the chair?
No.
Alright I’m gonna ask you one question.
What’s the question?
If you could change one thing about your body
what would you change?
Hm...
Um...
Hm...
Um...
You know, have a mermaid tail.
Probably like a shark mouth.
so I could eat a lot of stuff.
If I could have teleportation in my body.
Extra pointy ears.
I want legs like a cheetah so I can run faster like a cheetah.
I could have wings
so I can fly.
I don’t think there’s anything to change.
I like my body actually.
Yea, you wouldn’t change anything?
Nothing else.
Just a mermaid tail.
When was the last time we were comfortable in our own skin?
A lot of people obsess about getting older and about the wrinkles.
I love my white hair.
I loved it when it started turning white.
It’s one of those things
because I chose to stay this way
because it just wouldn’t be me if I totally changed the way I looked.
Hey guys! Thank you so much for watching the video.
We hope you enjoyed it.
We want to give a big shout out to iNature Skincare for sponsoring the film.
Make sure you check out their link below.
We wanted to make this film because these days it is so easy to be insecure about our body and our appearance
and we just wanted to make a film that really encourages you
to be comfortable and confident in your own skin.
For more films from Jubilee Project, please make sure to subscribe.
And as always, thanks and JP love!

comments.text:
If you could change one thing about your body what would it be?
The correct answer is: NOTHING.
We are all made perfect in our own ways, despite any flaws and differences.
Accept yourself and others as you are, if we do that no change is ever 
needed.﻿

comments.text:
i actually dun understand abt the comments written. real or not, thats not 
the point of the video. this video is to tell us that we shud just be 
thankful with what we hv right now. the climax of the story is not when the 
kids said the wan mermaid tails or anyth but when the grandma say she's 
happy when her white hair grows. its not about to differenciate kids and 
adults but to let everyone (including kids) that they should be happy with 
what they have. because there are still a lot of people who still wish to 
change.﻿

comments.author: TheLoe13

comments.text:
This video is just more about loving yourself,being comfortable with 
yourself really. Medical illnesses are a completely different issue though 
since it's a foreign battle in terms of your body overall.Bettering 
yourself by being healthy is also not a problem because you're working with 
what you've got. This video is more for those who don't like how big their 
ears look,why their skin isn't lighter,why their eyes aren't a different 
color,etc. It's sweet how when we're children we do not usually focus on 
the minimal things.The useless minute details.They live life to the 
fullest,expressing themselves without worry and always striving to learn. 
We all ought to listen to our inner child and realise that we only live 
once. Be happy,be content with yourself..focus on that and everything 
else(the bigger picture in life) will soon follow.
#mytwocents ﻿

comments.text:
Love it but there's no fat people here. Are you suggesting only people of 
certain body type can love or should love their bodies? This omission is 
chilling. But not too surprising. In this culture fat people are denied the 
basic respect and dignity accorded most other humans. We have a long way to 
go I guess. Hope your company will step off the fatphobia bandwagon real 
soon.﻿
comments.author: Marianne Baum

comments.text:
I think the major reason children are generally comfortable in their own 
skin than adults is because of something called "imaginary audience" which 
is when an individual believes that people around them are observant of 
their actions and choices. This is commonly seen during the adolescent 
stage and could explain why the older individuals in the video are more 
willing to change an aspect of their appearance than young children. It 
could be other things no doubt, but that's just my guess. ﻿

comments.author: Jamal C

comments.text:
children don't care for their appearance since they're kids and their 
parents take care of that, and even then many kids care about their 
appearance, especially as they enter puberty. Also the reason why old 
people don't care is because they've lived their life and had a husband and 
kids and no longer need to mate and find a partner, so they no longer need 
to impress anyone. People in their youth and middle ages are at the age 
where they want to find a partner to settle down with so they care more for 
their appearance to find a mate. It's just human nature, it has nothing to 
do with society whatsoever. This is just another cheesy video a bunch of 
film students made to cash in on the various similar videos made about body 
image. The film is sponsored by a cosmetics company - if you really think 
they give a shit about the "message" they're sending then you're an idiot. 
I agree that you should embrace yourself but wanting to be more handsome or 
beautiful is natural.﻿
